meanings.definition: A person who cuts down trees for timber.
meanings.sent1: The loggers worked hard in the forest every day.
meanings.sent2: The loggers harvested the trees to make furniture.
meanings.sent3: The loggers joked about having more tree friends than human friends.
meanings.sent4: The loggers were like modern-day lumberjacks, shaping the forest.
meanings.sent5: The loggers' axes echoed through the woods as they worked.

meanings.definition: A device for measuring the speed of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The ship captain relied on the loggers to determine the vessel's speed.
meanings.sent2: The loggers on the ship helped navigate through rough waters.
meanings.sent3: The loggers on the ship had a race to see who could measure the speed fastest.
meanings.sent4: The loggers' device hummed as it calculated the ship's velocity.
meanings.sent5: The loggers' tool was essential for safe navigation at sea.

meanings.definition: A program or device that records data.
meanings.sent1: The loggers on the computer saved all the information automatically.
meanings.sent2: The loggers captured every detail of the system's performance.
meanings.sent3: The loggers in the software had a party whenever they finished logging data.
meanings.sent4: The loggers in the program diligently stored all the necessary data.
meanings.sent5: The loggers' digital records were secure and organized.
